4 stars food, 2 stars service, 3 1/2 stars atmosphere: The food was good and reasonably priced for an upper end resturuant. The service was slow (especially in light of the fact that we went early in the evening and the place was practically empty). The atmosphere is nice and they do have a fantastic view....but the view windows were absolutely filthy....I have never seen such dirty windows in a resturant before (especially for a place in which a key feature is their view). I am not sure how these windows became so dirty (since it has to be a couple of months since the last time it rained here)....but come on guys, CLEAN THOSE WINDOWS!!!

Totally overated. I've tried this place twice now and doubt I'll be back. The service is TERRIBLE I truly cannot stress that enough. The servers disappear forever. We were constantly out of water, had to wait for almost 40 minutes to get our drinks.  The food took almost 2 hours to get to our table from the time we first arrived. The food was good but over priced. And my boyfriend became quite ill after having the lobster on our second visit.

What a view.  At the top of the Masquerade Tower at The Rio Hotel and Casino.  The menu is a little more than you see at a typical steak house.  Very unique drink menu.  The foi gras was extremely well prepared.  The Ménage e Tois  (filet, lobster tail, Shrimp) entree was excellent.  The bone in NY Strip was perfect.  A go to restaurant

I will give this restaurant 5 stars! Atmosphere and music were great! The waiter was nice and the photographer was pleasant. No wait when we were checking in for dinner. The views were amazing. As far as the food- we had the Mac n Cheese- yummy. Asparagus was tasty and we had the Australian Wagyu Steak (we shared the steak and the side were family style) OMG it was delicious, flavorful, well seasoned and cooked right. We shared all 3 items and were stuffed.. Forget the desserts, no room. Yes it is pricey but the quality of the food was well worth the money- you only live life once so enjoy it!  We will be coming back!!

Ate at the Voodoo twice over the first weekend in May. Considering it was the weekend of the Kentucky Derby and Mayweather fight, we thought it would be a bit busier. It was Actually half empty and the service was average at best. The food is good, naturally a bit over priced. The service is average. The ambience is GREAT and benefits from the after dinner access to the rooftop nightclub. Great way to end the evening. So despite average service and good but overpriced food, when in Vegas we come here for the dinner views and apres-meal rooftop experience.

We're convinced this restaurant is the reason anyone ever returns to the Rio. If only their hotel provided a comparable quality.

My wife and I were lucky enough to visit Voodoo Steak on the night after our wedding. It was our first dinner out as husband and wife. We also had the good fortune to be seated in Sam's section, and Sam provided exceptional service all night.

To start, we ordered an appetizer and a bottle of wine. After Sam brought over the wine and poured us each a glass, he invites us to go hang out on the outdoor balcony, overlooking the Strip, while the pork belly with apple and caramelized onions was being prepared. We did, and Sam came out about 5-10 mins later to let us know our first course was ready.

We came in and ate our delicious pork belly, and some tasty starter bread.  It wasn't long before my 8 oz. filet mignon with garlic buttery scallops came out with my wife's seared scallops.  We also ordered truffle mac & cheese. All i can say about them is "Wow."  My mouth is watering just thinking back.

As we finished up dinner, knowing our story, Sam provided complimentary champagne flutes. Classy move, much appreciated. We ordered some tasty coffee ice cream to finish the evening, and we left full, extremely satisfied, and impressed.

As we told Sam, we'll be back for our anniversary next year.

Hey, hey, hey now. . .. This place is AMAZING! Our reservation had us seated immediately by the window so we could have a lovely view of fabulous VEGAS!  

We started with the Veal cheek. We've never had it before and decided to give it a try. Although it was slightly greasy ( I think that is how it is supposed to be) it was pretty damn good. 
 
For my entree, I chose the VooDoo Menage A Trois which consisted of a 6oz petite filet, 4 oz lobster tail, jumbo prawns and I chose mashed potatoes. SERIOUSLY, oh my gawd! The whole meal just absolutely blew my mind. The steak was perfectly cooked, seasoned, tender & juicy. The lobster was prepared in an amazing sauce & was hands down the best I have ever had!

Pricey? Yes. BUT in this case you get what you pay for. Amazing service, food & ambiance. Thank you VooDoo for making the whole trip worth it!

Came here for my Fiance's birthday. The dinner was pricey because we decided to get a bottle of wine. The food was delicious and the views were great! Get the bananas foster....you wont be disapointed!
Amazing food and service!  The waiters are beyond belief, excellent Pinot noir wine, super awesome heirloom tomato salad combined with a ménage trois filet, lobster tail abs jumbo shrimp!

Absolutely worth the price!

Let's face it, prices in Vegas on the strip are high and this place is no exception. However, this place is totally worth the price!

Upon our arrival we asked for a window seat. They were fortunately able to accommodate our last-minute request within only a few minutes of our arrival. The views were amazing and we had the added bonus of watching the strip lights come on once the sun set. Beautiful. 

A bread basket is standard for all parties and service was friendly and efficient. I noticed a party next to us of over-sized drinks that looked fun but I wasn't drinking that night so I can't comment on the alcohol. 

My friend had the filet mignon and I had the scallops. Both were perfectly prepared and plated. I was very impressed with attention to detail. We also ordered several sides large enough for sharing. The lobster mac and cheese was okay although not as good as other posts suggest. However, if you're not worrying about carbs, worth a try. We also tried the green beans and the spinach. Both were good as well. 

If you're on a budget and would still like to try this gem, I would recommend a salad and side. Probably just as satisfying at 1/3 the cost.

Don't forget to go out on the viewing deck before or after your meal. It's beautiful to say the least.
Extremely nice view and very good food. Went to voodoo and mon Abi Gabi in Vegas and the voodoo was so much better in all aspects, except for price

Went with my husband and daughter and overall, had a good time. The view is spectacular. The food: it was good not excellent. I have had better steaks in other places. Ordered a rib eye medium, it came medium well. This surprised me since places that sell steaks at $50+ usually cook them perfectly (you know, they are expensive). Anyway, told the waiter and he tried to insist that the steak was medium - excuse me sir, I KNOW the difference between medium and medium well. If I'm paying almost $100 for a meal, I also expect, at least, good service and attention. He hesitantly took the steak and went to the kitchen. They brought another rib eye and this time it was cooked perfectly (medium rare they said). I didn't like the mashed potatoes, lacked flavor and seemed too starchy. The salad, meh....not good. One good thing, the cheesecake, it was delicious. The price, this place is expensive, really expensive. More expensive than Morton's and other good steakhouses in Vegas. Will we return? Nah, don't think so. The view is spectacular and you can enjoy it from their lounge which doesn't require you to attend the restaurant.

Who would have thought that the Rio would have one of my favorite steakhouses in town? We were looking for a restaurant to have dinner at before seeing Penn and Teller. We didn't think Rio would have anything good and almost wrote it off, but I'm so glad we tried Voodoo!

First, the restaurant has a cool vibe, definitely not your stuffy steakhouse. Dining at the restaurant gives access to the outdoor lounge and bar which have awesome views of the city and strip. The waiter encouraged us to check it out between courses. What a fun place to be on a nice summer night.

We started with drinks that were very good. My only critique would be the size of the drinks, they were about half the size of drinks at any other Vegas restaurant. Our first food item was the coconut shrimp with pina colada sauce. The coconut and pina colada pairing was delicious. I had my usual filet mignon. Yum! The steak was exactly what I look for in steak. It was buttery, flavorful and tender. It was the kind of steak that makes me wish I had ordered more than 8 ounces. My husband ordered the sea scallops that come with short rib and gnocchi. His dish was out of this world delicious. The sea scallops would have been awesome alone and the short rib would be awesome alone, but the two together were over the top in a good way.  Lastly, we ended with the bananas foster. The waiter does the lighting at the table which is pretty cool to see. I liked the taste, but it was a little too heavy on the alcohol taste. 

We'll definitely be back. This is a great place if you are looking for a good meal and a cool experience.

For our party of six;
Food was cooked perfectly and thoroughly enjoyed by everyone. Yes it's pricey but it's a premier Vegas steakhouse and you get what you pay for. The view is tremendous for fifty one stories up also! 

However the service left much to be desired. On a slow day, our server seemed to do the bare minimum and say as few words as possible. The back server was excellent though. 

In the end, very good place but besides the view, Ruth Chris is better in taste, price and service.

I took my sons here for Mothers Day/sons 21st birthday. We were going to have dinner, go to the club, and make it an unforgettable experience. Unfortunately, 2 out of 4 of us became I'll after eating the seafood. My youngest son and I had the steak, which was delicious! No complaints there. One son had the scallops and the other had the sea bass. One was throwing up at the restaurant and the other hours later. I called to report the incident to the restaurant. They took some notes and that was it. No offer of compensation, an apology to me...nothing. As a matter of fact, I had to keep calling  the restaurant just to get a hold of anyone to make the report! I did fill out the hotel survey afterwards and still, crickets...
Overall, poor customer service, lack of follow up and seafood is obviously not their forte.
After having spent $400 on a meal, I would expect a lot more on the service side from the management.

Service was great... "Candle light" dinner was a small votive on the table. Ordered the ménage a trios -filet, shrimp and lobster. Food was cold... Favor mediocre...very disappointed considering how much we paid. Husband faired a little better, ordered the special. At least his food was warm. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

So the main thing that this restaurant has going for them is the panoramic views of the city. The view is absolutely exquisite. Sadly that is where the selling point of this restaurant begins and ends.

I will make this short and sweet. 
I understand we technically got there when the restaurant was closing but they still decided to seat us even though they initially turned us away but since we were a large party I guess they saw dollar signs. 

Our server seemed annoyed by our presence and barely checked on us during the meal. For the prices of the meal I expect to receive 5 star service and it was more like 1 star. I've had better service at Chilli's. All the food i ordered was just ok nothing out of this world and definitely does not match the prices that go with it.

Please be aware that if you dine here you are basically paying for the view above anything else. The upside there is a rooftop lounge above the restaurant, which seemed to be playing pretty good music.

Voodoo steak has an amazing location. Atop the Rio is has a great view of the strip at night. Order some drinks, then apps and wait for your entrees to come out on the balcony with your glass of cab. 

Lobster bisque, Foie gras app, seafood platter, 18oz steak, and sea bass were all very good. Compliments to the chef!
Christian is on point. Food is amazing. When I am impressing people, I bring them here.

Apparently the air conditioning was out as there were several fans placed around the dining room.  The steaks were well cooked, but were not the quality cuts you would expect for $60. The service was adequate but again, the overall experience was not what you would expect for the prices they charge. And I don't expect a roving photographer trying to sell me $40 photos. 
If you have anywhere to be after your meal give yourself plenty of time.  It took nearly an hour to get our meal, with a mostly empty restaurant. 
Overall very disappointed. Ruths Chris deserves your money way more than Voodoo Steakhouse.

We showed up around 6pm. No reservation. We were immediately sat in a booth with prompt and very friendly service by Samuel and Alejandro. Our meal arrived quickly and was excellent. I had the New York steak and my wife the Scallops. Creme brûlée for desert. This will be on the menu for our next trip.
Absolutely loved this place, and our server was awesome and attentive. One of the best steaks I've ever had. The macaroni and baked potato were just as on point!!

We had reservations for 7:00pm last night.  I can't say enough how fantastic of a night we had.  From the wonderful elevator ride to the top.  To the hostess that greeted us when we walked in.  To the beautiful table we had (we were on the West side so we looked out to the mountains)(if you want to see the strip views - ask for the East side or a view of the strip) Regardless ALL views at the top of the Rio are fantastic!
Well JOHN our waiter was WONDERFUL.  He was tentative, funny, informative about all items on the menu and I am so glad that we had JOHN as our drinks, bread, salad and our main course was served superbly!  After we received our drinks (and before our salad) JOHN suggested we go out on the balcony of the Voodoo Lounge and check out the view.  WOW it was amazing!  we sat out there with our drinks for about 20 minutes.  Taking photos and just enjoying the spectacular sights!  JOHN let us kow that if you eat dinner you have access to the Voodoo Lounge all night.  We told him we had Penn & Teller tickets - so he told us to come back after the show and enjoy the night in the Voodoo Lounge.  How cool is that?  Free entry to a club in Las Vegas.  WOW!
As soon as we walked back to our table - JOHN served our salad.  JOHN was on the ball!  Boy, I sure hope Voodoo Steak realizes what a gem JOHN is to have as an employee.  We finished up our meal.  All unbelievably cooked to perfection.  I had the salmon and my husband had the rib eye.  Baked potatoes for our sides.
Well we knew we had to leave soon as the show was soon upon us.  We didn;t want to go.  We just wanted to stay up there all night.  So back down that fabulous elevator and onto the show.
What a great night!  Penn & Teller we great and a huge THANK YOU to the RIO Hotel for entertaining us!
Cheers!

Thought I'd put this one out here... Your dollars can certainly be better spent. Regardless of the Vegas premium you pay for some of the finer restaurants, this place is straight up not worth it- period. Yes, it's 50 floors up and looks great at night but all of that is haunted by below average appetizers, over priced wine (seriously over priced..), and some of the saltiest fare one can purchase. I'm not going to rail every dish but some notables or warnings would be to avoid the coconut shrimp (laughable..could bounce all the back up from 50 floors), lobster bisque (I've had better from the grocery section), and the Voodoo Caesar salad. I will say that the Caesar reminded exactly of the tray of salad you can get at Costco with a little siracha mixed in, might try that at home..

In short, pop in for a cocktail and a picture then bail.

Cheers!

As a local that has dinned at the Voodoo Steakhouse for all our special occasions, I come to learn after making reservations to take my fiancée this year for his birthday they decided to charge $100 PER PERSON to have a window seat. We have dinned there plenty of times.  I will never go back to pay $100 for a window seat that used to be NO CHARGE. VERY DISAPPOINTED

Ok, more like 3.8 stars. I ordered seafood at a steakhouse so that was probably my mistake. :-( My boyfriend and our other friend both ordered steaks and were in loooove. They tasted pretty good! I just wasn't in the mood for a slab of meat.

I ordered a lobster pasta, and it was just.. bland and a little disappointing for the price that I was paying. It wasn't bad, it just didn't taste amazing either. Some of the lobster pieces were overcooked and rubbery feeling. The pasta itself had little to no flavor... Again, my mistake for ordering seafood at a steakhouse.

The view though --- gorgeous panoramic views of the strip. They have a patio area that you can go out to and just enjoy the view, take some pictures, and hang out with your drinks. That was probably the best part about dining here. 

Our server was also great and very friendly. He was quick to get us the things we needed and to correct any mistakes. He brought out the wrong side dish for my friend, and quickly remedied the problem (and let us keep the extra dish at no charge). The filet mignon that my friends ordered were yummy from what I could tell, and they were super satisfied with their meal.

Such an awesome place.  Beautiful views and one of the best meals I have had Vegas! I ordered the filet and it was cooked perfectly. So juicy. The asparagus and mushrooms are also the best we have ever had. It is definitely pricey but worth it!!

Showed up at Voodoo Steak for my birthday dinner. Imagine my chagrin when I found out I'd made the reservation for another day. Well the hostess was cool enough to find a table for my party even on a busy night. When then had a delicious dinner with great service. Special praise for Jamal our server.  The filet mignon was delicious. We left happy and smiling. Full marks.

VooDoo Steak was the best dining experience I had on my recent trip to Vegas. Service was 5-star plus. Here's what happened - we had made a reservation to enjoy a group dinner before the Penn & Teller show on Saturday night - only we mistakenly made the reservation for Friday night. When we showed up on Saturday, the hostesses never doubted us and they tried really hard to find our reservation.  They were super polite about it, no attitude whatsoever, but there was no reservation anywhere on their system. We checked our email, and there is was - for Friday, the night before! We had a fairly large party and it was a Saturday night and very crowded, so we were slightly panicked. The staff moved things around, did a little magic and pulled a rabbit out of a hat! They found us a great table with a view and up we went --- the glass elevator ride is part of the whole experience and once we were seated we still had plenty of time before the show to enjoy the excellent service, terrific cocktails (some of the best in Vegas!) and amazing food. Perfect steak! Sidebar-  its fun, though a bit unnerving for me, to watch brave people ride the zip line while you're eating. I highly recommend VooDoo Steak for a nice evening out, delicious food and amazing service. You should also definitely check out Penn & Teller while you're there, theshow is a blast!

I went to  VooDoo Steak with 3 others. It was a Wednesday evening (around 7) and the place was relatively empty. But, we were told that to sit at a window, we would have to each spend a minimum of $100. [This really isn't hard to do with their inflated prices--we actually spent a bit over $400 for the four of us.] What disturbed me was that everyone dining there could have been seated at a window table but instead they insisted on this antiquated and insulting practice. The food was adequate, nothing more. You have to read the menu with the server's flashlight which was also annoying. All in all, one star is more than adequate.

Our waiter was great! Jamal. Impeccable service and really decent food. It's a bit pricey but quality seemed good. My girl had crab legs and filet  and I had a  ribeye. We shared a side and a lobster bisk. Like I said pricey however, locals and rewards members may be eligible for a discount so ask. Waiter was personable and I hope he's there my next time. Food good quality.... Portions ok, sides ok, & view is great as its on the roof. Good occasion spot!

What a View!  Take the elevator to the top!  This is a good choice for dinner before the Penn and Teller show which is also in the Rio.  View great, Service Great,  Atmosphere Great, Food Very Good.  I will come here again when we're in the area..  Nightclub upstairs opens at eight.  Flexible attire.

i was here long time ago, and i still have good memories. we went to the roof top club after we had dinner... but... the dinner was excellent... i had the special that night, which was half a lobster and 8oz filet... this was the best for the taste, and also for the pocket. thats my two favorite combo. however, one of own friend did not get his plate almost 15 minutes later, he ordered same thing i did... other then that, the view of the strip is awesome as we were dinning  on our dinner and the service was excellent. i would come back here again

On on 1/1/2016 - we checked in at our hotel and decided that we were starving. Met up with a good friend of mine from high school with her hubby. We didn't want have to leave our hotel & drive or have to deal of getting a cab or Uber so we decided stay put and picked this place. We ordered Ceasar Salad, Shrimp Cocktail as appetizer. The Shrimp Cocktail was yummy - the sauce was perfect. Both of my girl friends ordered their scallops with grits and mushroom. I ordered the crab and lobster pasta salad with cream sauce. Jay ordered their Filet, another friend ordered Rib Eye and Salmon. Jay's filet was overcooked - he asked for medium rare and it came medium. It was more cooked than he and I liked. The scallops were delicious - melt in your mouth! Loved the flavor. Our friends liked their salmon and Rib Eye. Mine was disappointingly ok - the crab was cooked a little too long so it was a little rubbery. There wasn't much cream in the sauce and just needed more flavor. We were starving so no one bothered to complain. We also ordered sides - asparagus, truffle Mac & Cheese and French Fries. The asparagus was too al-dente for my taste, loved the Truffle Mac & Cheese and of course, you can't possible go wrong with Pomme Frits!!! Their selection of bread was good as well. And love the view! I just wished for the price we paid for dinner, it was perfect. Can't have it all I guess.

We arrived with a 5:45 reservation but could not sit by the window due to staffing. The view is the point of this place. Our booth had the most annoying light overhead that killed the ambience. Food was so overpriced. Ordered a Caesar salad that was mediocre at best. Steak just ok. When they  bussed the table they stacked every plate on top of each other, on the table in front of us. Gross! Then left all the crumbs and never came back. Two people, $175 with one beer and one glass of wine. Shared a steak. Fine dining price with Appleby's service!! Will NEVER go back. I do not recommend this place-save your money.

This was an amazing experience. The view from the 50th floor was spectacular! The Tomahawk Ribeye was hands down one of the best steaks I've ever had. I did not give 5 stars because our server, although polite, paid much more attention to his other tables than to us. Also the food took unusually long compared to others around us. The food was worth the wait.

Nice view, inside was decorated very nicely, has the upscale feel. Balcony connected to restaurant that also is the balcony of the voodoo lounge club I ordered the filet mignon it was the best steak I've ever had, very soft my wife had the manage a trois wich is steak shrimp and lobster very good

Fantastic dinner option if staying at The Rio, or the nearby Vegas Strip and willing to travel. Absolutely blown away by Voodoo Steak and their level of top-tier food and service. The view from on top was amazing, and allowed for access to the outside deck and photo ops at The Zipline. The braised veal cheek appetizer was phenomenal, and the perfect lead to what was one of the best 12 oz. filet mignon steaks I've ever had. My wife's lobster was spot on, and served with a drawn butter which could undoubtedly be described as glorious. Every dish was cooked to perfect medium/med-rare, flawlessly seasoned, and paired brilliantly with complimentary accoutrement. A side of the intoxicating truffle mac 'n cheese was the perfect (and only) way to complete what was for us a fantastic dining experience.  Our dinner plans for future Lost Wages trips have instantly been compromised, as Voodoo was one for the memories.

Many years ago the Voo Doo Lounge was one of my parents favorite restaurants and they ate here every time they came to Vegas.  Since then several new hotels and restaurants have popped up and although the RIO is a nice hotel it's definitely now one of the older ones and so is this restaurant.

I was more than excited to try this place, I was with a few co workers and since we were staying at the RIO, it made sense to have dinner here this evening.  For drinks I enjoyed the sangria which was fabulous followed by a glass of red with dinner, I've heard the witches brew drink is amazing but I was with my boss and co worker so I didn't want to get too crazy :).  The food and the service unfortunately I wasn't impressed with.  I felt very rushed and I really like to sit back and dine for hours upon end at a nice restaurant like this.  I also thought it was extremely expensive, now I don't mind paying $40 for a salmon dish as long as it's truly mouth watering and the side of veggies isn't just 2 pieces of cauliflower.  The one thing I'm picky with is the temperature of food, I like my food piping hot, I don't know what it was this week but everything I had was just warm.

I ordered the salmon dish, the plate was cold so obviously the fish went cold quickly, I even heat my plates in the oven at my own house when I'm cooking myself a hot meal.  We also ordered a few sides including the mushrooms and asparagus which came out 10 minutes after our meal, it would have been nice to have our sides with our meals.  Again these weren't very hot either and by the time they got to me and onto my cold plate they were freezing.  My salmon was okay, nothing special compared to any other piece of salmon I've had, I enjoyed the mushrooms, the wine was good and I have to say the one thing I enjoyed the most was the cracker/pita bread thing that came out with the bread when we arrived.  We didn't have dessert and because we said no to dessert the next thing you know, plates are cleared and the bill is on the table and we were out the door.  One trick I've learned is to always accept a dessert menu as it saves you time from being so rushed out.

The view is gorgeous and the rooftop upstairs is beautiful and a great spot to have your a picture taken but overall I'm just not that impressed.  I think so many other amazing places have popped up since the hype of the VooDoo opened.  I'd go back if the prices were a bit lower, portions were a bit bigger and my food was piping hot!

Didn't know what to expect really. Being off the strip on on the roof attached to a night club I expected over priced and average at best food. They have this signature drink that is kind of cool because it comes out all smokey. It is way over priced though. That being said, they have this $70 waygu steak that could be the best steak I have ever eaten. I have eaten a lot of steaks and it was really phenomenal. That combined with the views make it worth the visit

The views were spectacular!  The steak was really flavorful and cooked as ordered.  The biggest problem we had was our server.  Due to a food allergy, we informed our server that we needed our sides to be gluten free.  We inquired about the green beans with shallots and almonds and the lemon aioli asparagus as they seemed like they might be harmless.  He told us he didn't think there would be a problem with those sides, but would double check just to make sure.  He never came back, so we assumed it was fine.  When our food came out, we were served plain, dry, barely warmed up asparagus and green beans.  We asked what happened and he said the almonds in the green beans were brushed with flour and the aioli sauce had flour in it so he had them prepare it without.  While we appreciated that he was looking out for the allergy issue, we asked why didn't he come back and tell us this so we could decide on different sides that were gluten free as the main reason we wanted to try those sides were because of the flavors, not just to be given plain steamed vegetables at $11 each!  His response was to just turn and walk away, never to be seen again until he literally threw the check on our table.  We then called over a manager who comped the vegetables and offered us another glass of wine, which we declined.  We just wanted to be done at that point.
Been here many times. Never disappoints. Great food with excellent service! The view is amazing!

Reservations were time consuming and just tried to get sales information for rewards card.  Food was decent but a little tough on the Tomahawk cut.  However, at end, the water boy threw away wife's food we asked to be boxed.  As we waited for replacement it was clear we were being ignored so we left.

This has a 25p off locals discount available that is factored into my review. If paying full priceI wouldnt have been quite as happy. I have eaten here 5 times in the last year. I have never had a bad meal, the atmosphere is fine, service is spotty and can be slow. I cant complain about any of the sides or steaks thatbI have ordered, Wine isnt a bargain, as others pointed out.

My wife and I ate dinner at VooDoo on Monday March 21,2016. Views of LV were great.  Service was poor due to lack of staff.  Waiter was friendly but maybe he had too many tables, My $48 pork Chop was dry and overcooked, and green beans were under cooked.  How hard is it to cook green beans... For the price, I will not return.  but maybe a bad night, so judge for yourself...if just for the views.

This is a fancy steakhouse and you should expect high prices.  The presentation is fantastic they managed to make salads into art.  The flavors are great and Louisiana inspired.  This place has some of the best ambiance in Las Vegas.  I love the very dim lighting and the amazing views from atop the Rio.

The steak tartar here was some of the best I've had in the last year. Great presentation, wonderful flavor.

My filet with garlic and horseradish mash was served exactly as I ordered it, rare. The macaroni and cheese was rich. The vegetables were cooked nicely, flavorful, and not overdone. Overall, this was an excellent meal in a sophisticated atmosphere. My dinner companions and I had a lovely evening.

The wine selection was good, though a touch pricey as compared to other places, but to be expected.

Service was genial, prompt, and detail oriented.

A friend recommended VooDoo Steakhouse and I decided to check it out while I was in Vegas for a conference. It's located at the Rio and has great view of the Strip. Food is great and definitely worth the price. Will visit again next time I am in Vegas.

I don't normally give out negative reviews, but this case warrants it. My fiance and I went here to celebrate our engagement. We had saved for awhile and decided to splurge here. We should have chosen differently. The service was decent, our server was fairly attentive. The food was disappointing...for the price of the steaks, I would have expected something a little more on par with Gordon Ramsay Steak. The real issue came after we got home and later that night. We both became quite ill, with signs and symptoms indicating food poisoning. We called and informed the restaurant and were brushed off, stating they "would look into it." No apology or renumeration was offered.  So if you're looking for excellent service and superb steak, go to Gordon Ramsay's!

I had the menage a trois combo which included a 6 ounce filet mignon, jumbo shrimp, lobster tail with mashed potatoes with a medley of vegetables. I also had the lobster bisque soup which was excellent as a starter. The restaurant was not very busy so I was a little surprised at the poor attention to service. When the waiter checked in to ask me how my meal was I mentioned that the carrots were undercooked and so was the lobster tail. He did not offer to fix it and just looked at me and walked away. Overall I would say the meal was better than average but certainly not worth the hundred dollar price tag for one dinner!

Had the lobster seafood pasta. It was great. Others in my party had the filet and the baked chicken. They were good, but nothing special. The truffle Mac and cheese was a little over loaded with truffle, but tasty. We also ordered the asparagus. It was very good. We never ordered drinks because we were not offered a drink list. Overall the food was very good, but the service didn't warrant the $45-$60 price that we paid for entrees. I don't think that I would go back due to the underwhelming service. However I might get the pasta to-go. It was yummy.

The steak I had was stinky. Super stinky. I eat beef 3-6 times a week. Nice waiter, good service. 
I won't dine here again, the meat is trash. I brought mine home to feed to my dogs. I hope they like $59 steak but don't get sick from it.

My first vacation to Las Vegas and I was taken to the Voodoo Steakhouse AMAZING! The service was great and the Voodoo Doctor Sampler and the Maine Lobster and Crab Pasta was to die for and the view is breath taking!!!

The food was great! We had booked through a full girls night package and all expenses were taken care of in advance. The Waiter seemed to have the attitude that we were not making him any money and he did not want to be serving us. We tipped well over the bill price if we would have had a bill. The view was great once you went outside to the balcony. The windows on the side of the restaurant were so dirty that you could not see the beautiful view from the inside. Overall great food, clean inside, and perfect at sunset.

Food was good but it's hard to look past the price tag of the entrees and of course the steaks are a la carte.  We made a reservation for our anniversary because it was recommended but it wasn't at all crowded.  The place could use some updating and a lot of tables had random mismatched chairs.  The view was nice but it wasn't a "take your breath away" view, I think there is a certain side of the restaurant to sit on that has a better view.  They don't put the prices on their drink menu which I hate.  My husband and I ordered the 'witch doctor' and it was huge!  We tried to pace ourselves so we didn't get too drunk because it was still early in the night.  I much admit we were both slightly disappointed in how fine we felt when it was gone.  The drink ended up costing $40 which the waiter of course didn't tell us when we ordered but we heard him tell another couple how much it was when we were done.  The water was refilled frequently but our used bread plates sat for while on the table.  Overall, good experience but probably won't be going back anytime soon.

Dinner for three at the Voodoo steak in the Rio Hotel. . Waiter was amazing. We all had a fillets, salad and sides. Salad was good, as were the baked potatoes and Mac and cheese. The disappointing part of our meal were the steaks. They arrived on a big white plate with a couple Brussel  sprouts.  My small filet looked lost. No bother, I was hungry. The steak ordered med. rare was overcooked and absolutely tasteless. It was not charred, or juicy.  Just a bland, no color, no taste steak. I was really disappointed, and when we got  the check for just over $300, I decided they needed A review on yelp. We usually eat at the All American downstairs in the Rio, and will go there from now on. They have great steaks!  The Voodoo has the view of Las Vegas, and the atmosphere we all want, but I give them only one star for the steak. The waiter on the other hand, was five star excellent. Try the steak house downstairs.
The best steak I have ever had! The service was amazing and everything you should come to expect! John, our waiter, thank you!!!

Amazing views of the strip from 50 floors on top of the Rio.  The Rio is off the beaten path and showing it's age but this restaurant and bar held up well.  Stopped here for dinner before seeing Penn and Teller one night this week. Was not as expensive as some of the strip hotels and the food was better than I expected.  Service was top notch.  You can walk out onto the roof bar and see all around the tower - great views!  They also have a zip line between the towers, fun to watch but be warned they shoot you over and then have to pull you back, two rides for the price of one!  Anyway, food was good, prices were good and services was stunning - worth taking a trip off the strip to visit the Rio while you're in town.

name: Hank's DJ Audio Equipment Rental
full_address:
4644 Camden Bridge St
Spring Valley
Las Vegas, NV 89147

reviews.text: I rented a mixer from this rental business and I was very happy with the mixer worked great and had so much fun . I will definitely be renting from here again. The guy who brought me the equipment was professional and showed me the mixer before I played to assure me the condition of the mixer prices were great.

Mark is so professional and excellent to work with. His equipment is up to date and in excellent condition. Didn't have any problem what so ever with the equipment. Mark came last minute to set up and install the equipment with no issue at all. I will recommend Mark to anyone who wants to rent DJ equipment at a reasonable price. Mark is a excellent choice.

I rented audio equipment for my wedding and I had an amazing experience working. They delivered and pick up everything for free on time. Equipment was a high quality and prices for fantastic! Thank you! 

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

name: home-ology
full_address:
7001 N Scottsdale Rd
Ste 142
Scottsdale, AZ 85253

reviews.text: The guys who run this fun home decor store couldn't be greater.  If you have a question, they'll readily look up the answer for you on their computer or in a vendor catalog.  They focus on using recycled or renewable materials.  For example, I learned today (at home-ology) that mango wood is a sustainable resource, because mango trees eventually quit producing fruit, and the trees are often cut down and destroyed by the growers.  But the wood is attractive, and is now being used to produce furniture, lamps, and other home accessories.  They have a fun line of reusable shopping bags (so cute) and these awesome fragrance lamps that are beautiful and fill your home with a wonderful scent.

The owners of this store are truly businessmen that I would trust. 

On top of the wonderful products they always have, they also offer great advice when decorating your home.

I recommend their business to anyone. At least stop by and check out what they have to offer.

Homeology has a lot of great and interesting items. Ryan and Chris are great people. They are very friendly and knowledgeable about the different products that they sell. I really recommend this location.

name: The Edinburgh Bookshop
full_address:
219 Bruntsfield Place
Edinburgh EH10 4DH

reviews.text:
This shop is definitely one of a kind in Edinburgh. It's a really quality bookshop with both fiction and nonfiction, hardback and paperback and the most thoughtful staff ever. I definitely recommend talking to the staff, 'cause they're really passionate and really quite frighteningly knowledgeable.

 A friend of mine worked there for a bit and she said that during her interview they grilled her a la interrogation-blinding-light style on her knowledge of literature. Which is quite comforting, because I do get bit put off a bookshop when they don't know as much as I do about literature (being a meager English Lit. graduate). And it definitely demonstrates the kind of passion you don't often find anymore.

The bookshop itself is very clean and tidy (so don't go there expecting one of those second-hand bookshops you could get lost in), and their books are obviously carefully picked out. 

It's admittedly pricey, but if you can afford to give to an independent book seller, than you should (just for the sake of keeping the business going).

Another brilliant independent bookshop for children - and their parents! - is The Children's Bookshop in Bruntsfield. Established in 2007, it's a quirky shop with bright and colourful books enticingly displayed on wooden bookshelves and tables. There's picture books and alphabet books for toddlers, short stories and educational aids for four, five and six year olds and a mix of fiction and illustrated books for school children. If you look closely you'll also find, science fiction and young adult novels for teenagers. 

A labour of love, TCB is owned and run by Vanessa and Malcolm Robertson - who also run childrens publishing company Fidra Books. Their fingerprints are clearly all over the shop from the imaginative window displays to regular events with high profile authors like Neil Gaiman and Cathy Cassidy.

If only I was seven again...

I've never quite grown out of children's books - it seems that what you read earliest in your life is often what stays with you longest.  For me, therefore, my visit to the Children's Bookshop in Bruntsfield was a real nostalgic pleasure, as I stumbled across old favourites and reminisced about being 12 years old again.

Obviously, the shop mainly caters for those who are still actually children now, and so stocks plenty of recent children's literature alongside much-loved classics.  The shop is well laid out, with titles arranged according to age range, and an atmosphere conducive to browsing, while the staff are knowledgeable and used to making helpful suggestions if you're stuck for a gift for a juvenile nephew/little sister/other small person of your acquaintance.

I also always feel pleased about supporting an independent bookshop, and while the Children's Bookshop might not offer the massive range or discount prices of retail giants such as Waterstones, it offers instead a more personal way to buy books.

Ok so I'd already reviewed this place, but I'm not sure if it moved up the street or what but a slightly different address is now being listed as "closed" so, here's my review for the "non closed" listing:

The thing with a bookstore is that they have to do a lot to compete with the likes of Amazon.  Unfair?  Maybe, but true.  It's just so easy to order online, and you know that you'll be able to find what you're looking for.  When you go into a bookstore, you risk them either not carrying or being out of what you want.

BUT - when you buy online, you miss out.  Have you ever wandered into a bookstore for one thing and come out with an arm-full?  I do that, a lot.  I can't help myself.  Books I've never head of are cleverly displayed which makes me pick them up and read the jacket and realise that it sounds fabulous, so I buy and subsequently love it.  Now that's an experience you wouldn't have online.

Anyway... the Edinburgh Bookshop manages to serve up the benefits of going to an actual bookstore (paired with incredibly lovely, helpful, and impressively knowledgeable staff - bonus!) with the convenience of shopping online.  By that I mean that they will happily order anything you like.  And, if they can't get it for any reason, they'll let you know how and where you can order it yourself.  

Seeing as it's located directly next to my bus stop, this makes it *more* convenient, and certainly more enjoyable than shopping online.

I'm definitely a convert.

name: Dis & Dat Auto Wrecking & Repair
full_address:
2635 Bledsoe Ln
Sunrise
Las Vegas, NV 89156

reviews.text: worse place ever!!!!!! do not buy parts from them!!!!!!!!!!!

While calling around to get estimates for replacement of the right axle we were referred here. Got a decent quote and brought my niece's car in on a Saturday and was told will be finished by end of the day. 

Later we received a call advising that both sides of the axle needed repair (they never looked at the car prior) and we approved it. 

What an incredible surprise to receive a call before 2pm that the car was finished AND the total repair for both axles was less than the estimate!

Note: the place was difficult to find if relying on GPS and not familiar with the area. It wanted us to turn on streets that didn't exist.

I needed a few parts to fix up this old car. I've been to 10 yards in town and called double that. I found a few, but only after many that said they had the part, but did not, and others that smelled of urine with the employees drinking beer at the counter. 
Damn is this place just the opposite. The employees are coherent and actually care, the place is clean and the prices are more than reasonable.After I got a part from the one yard where they pull the part, he showed me the other yard where it is $15 for whatever you pull yourself. Great price and selection.
Thanks guys!

name: International House of Pancakes
full_address:
225 E Apache Blvd
Tempe, AZ 85281

reviews.text:
I won't lie, the place is sometimes dirty.  Sometimes the food sucks.  I mean I've been eating IHOP food on and off for many years, and before eating at this particular one I would have bet money that you would seriously have to try to screw it up badly.  Also, sometimes the service sucks.  They forget items, they don't remember your special requests, they may or may not bring you condiments, utensils, or even remember to wipe your table.

Why then? Why in the world would I give this place four stars?  It's simple.  On Friday and Saturday nights around 2:30, magic happens.  It's generally best to arrive early, say at 2:15 for prime seating.  Around 2:25 the trainwreck begins in earnest.  Liquored up college students shuffle in by the carload.  There will be laughter, tears, raucous and raunchy behavior.  Some will wander off to the bathroom.  Most of them will return.  Random people will start conversations with you.  Some lucky (unlucky?) strangers will hook up.  There may be dancing, singing, even removal of various items of clothing.  You may choose to raise the stakes a little by betting on your favorite contenders for likely drunken behaviors such as, that guy is going to pass out at his table.  Or that girl is coming back from the bathroom with vomit in her hair.

It's a lot like a bar or club but the music isn't as loud so it's easier to eavesdrop and / or join conversations.  Plus the real fun is in going completely sober.  Sure, I still like to tie one on now and again and I am certainly not always be a saint in public.  Every once in a while though it's fun to step outside of that and imagine how I must look to everyone else who isn't having the good time I'm having.  When I need a long hard look at myself, I find the patrons of this particular IHOP to  be  excellent mirrors. Especially at the aforementioned times.

Come on now, who doesn't enjoy a little schadenfreude with their hashbrowns?

I am asking conscientious consumers who believe in voting with their dollars to boycott this establishment because they tow the cars of paying customers.

A week ago me and three friends met at the IHOP (International  House of Pancakes) on Apache and Forrest.   I left a HUGE tip to make up for the fact that we didn't purchase all that much food, and the waiter was quite nice. When one friend arrived at IHOP, he thought we were meeting by my dorm (which is literally across the street) and walking over, so he parked at IHOP, called us and walked across the street. And in less than 30 seconds walked BACK across the street and into IHOP.

His car was towed WHILE HE WAS INSIDE IHOP. We walked out, couldn't find his car and didn't panic. We knew in our hearts that as PAYING CUSTOMERS, an honest mistake was made and they would take care of us. Nope, not the case. I immediately went back in and asked for the reciept, which the cashier gave me. She was very nice and apologetic and reassuring. As I did that, the one who's car was towed was on the phone with the towing contractor who told him we needed to get a note from IHOP's manager. OK easy enough. So we asked and he began writing the note, and then for whatever reason he called the towing company.

Because the towing company's payed spotter (you know that this towing is lucrative for them if they pay a spotter to look for students) saw him cross the street he refused to write a note saying that we were paying customers. 

I still can't believed this happened. We argued with him for a while, started out quite nice but it degenerated. I swear the manager was smiling for most of the time while telling us "there was nothing he could do." Ultimately he lied to us and said it was the responsibility of the hotel because they had contract with the towing company. So far, we have been unable to resolve this in a reasonable way.

It kills me how businesses here treat students. Because there are so many of us, they realize that they can treat us poorly and take advantage of us all over the place, and no matter how many they drive away there will always be more students. I feel really powerless about this, I don't know what I can do to fix it except tell everyone what happened. So I am asking you to PLEASE not go to IHOP while they maintain this policy of abusing students. We can fight back by boycotting them!

This was a good place with lots of room inside and very clean. The staff was friendly that southern friendly that annoys people from
The north.
The food was very good. Better than
Denny's and I would recommend it as good place to get out of the sun.

I have been here a few times, given its proximity to the ASU campus. It IS convenient, but there's hardly anything else I can say about the place. Every time I went, the food took around 30 minutes to come out, which would be excusable except that the waitress mysteriously disappeared for those 30 minutes. We couldn't get water or ask if they forgot our food - in fact, I had to get up and talk to the random staff coming out of the kitchen to make sure they didn't forget about us a couple visits, something that I don't necessarily love to do.

I'm usually somewhat forgiving in the aspects of service. I know how tough customers and customer service can be, and I always try to be a 'good' customer so as to make their day brighter. However, I can't justify such a large establishment just forgetting about a party in the restaurant, especially when the prices call for some degree of decent service. Two stars because although the food is alright and the hours are 24/7, I can't justify the price for the lack of service. Also, food is sometimes scattered across the floor when we arrive. Slightly disgusting.

Went here today with my best friend and thought the place could have been way better. the staff are all young kids which doesn't bother me, but our waiter was a little strange, couldn't remember simple things like what drinks we got, and it wasn't busy so it wasn't like he had to remember many things. The food was good though. But i've been to better Ihops.

A few nights ago I went here for the first time in a loooong time. My friend and I went after our night class and were there for close to two hours. And unfortunately, it's not because we were having riveting conversation that kept us in our booth. It took FOREVER to get our drinks, to get our order taken, to get our food, and to get our check. For an omelette and some pancakes. I can't say I'd never return, but the service this time around just wasn't that great.
The worst I have ever visited, the service sucked waited for 20 minutes for coffee creamer, asked for ketchup and it took another 20 minutes and the place was not busy at all.

This IHOP is just like every other IHOP except for its proximity to ASU campus. I have eaten there so many times that I cannot even count them. All due to proximity and availability, never due to desire. 

This is the only restaurant I have watched someone get sick in. It is packed after the bars get out at 2am. It is busy all night. Often with those who are under 21 but over 18 drinking coffee and acting as though it is their living room. 

Go here for sustenance only!!
International Pancakes, in a House thereof. The service can suck if they've got a new person on staff, or if you're an asshole, but usually it's the only reason to go.
Usually i am here after ive been drinking... so i see drunk people and i eat... thats about all im good for there. lol
I would eat here everyday if I had friends to go with.

This location was right by ASU. It was empty on a holiday. Our server was great. The food was cooked perfectly. And they even had a "study hall" for students which I thought was a great idea. The only suggestion that comes from who I attended with is that if there is an upcharge that the waitress mentions it prior to getting a surprise on your bill. There is mention of it in the menu, but it doesn't spell out that there is an extra $2 for a slice of cheese on your eggs.

Busy as all of them seem to be. Large menu of choices. I tried a new egg dish and it was excellent.  Also the maple coffee is so yum I wonder why every barista isn't making it?  Hmmm I think I need one of those this week!  And their coffee drinks are cheap!  If it wasn't always a wait I would eat there more.
I only go to ihop for pancakes because I don't really like anything else on the menu. Ordered chocolate chip pancakes and a hot chocolate. Everything was great and I left full and satisfied!!
It's IHOP... What more needs to be said? :)

Don't ever expect too much when you come to an IHOP except for lots of pancake fun. It's location is tucked inside a hotel parking lot. Never very busy at the times I have gone.   Love their all you can eat pancake specials when they have them.  Last time I tried the banana caramel pancake that they had on special and it was sinfully fabulous.  
Because the place wasn't very packed the wait staff was not very attentive to needs. Water glasses were refilled regularly.  Also they have a problem with splitting the bill and it doesn't matter what time of day or night that it is.

Literally right across the street from the Hayden Hall dorms, the staff is always friendly, and students can catch the school wifi if they sit near the windows.

A lot of the staff is young, probably students, and inexperienced, but always polite and willing to listen.

The few times I have had a bad server, I've never seen them more than once.

And the hot chocolate is to DIE for at 3am when you can't sleep.

Went in, middle of the afternoon. Only two tables are seated.  A cook from the back came out, saw us and went back to the kitchen. We waited to be seated for 10+ minutes and eventually left and went to Riverview IHOP. 

The next day, we tried the IHOP on Apache again. It was morning and packed. Waited again for a while, no one came to seat us. Back to Riverview.
Won't be returning.

It's not the best of places, but hey, it's IHOP. For the most part, this is actually a pretty sweet place. It is right next to a bunch of dorms on the ASU campus, across the street from Gammage, and is near Mill Ave. Awesome location. The big problem though is that the service here often varies, usually I find myself getting poor service unless I go when friends of mine are working (but that could just be because they know me). You'll get your food, and it will be just fine. But don't expect exceptional service.

This is the best ihop in the valley. So go there because they have great service and everyone is nice. The food is really good. My favorite food is the pancakes. They are the best, so next time you go try the whole wheat pancakes. This is also a very good place for kids. That's all Folks.

Every time I come here the staff is always super friendly. If would want to be sieatted away from the noise of the other customers they make sure of that. 
I have been here in the morning for breakfast, business lunches, and even after a night on mill. I have always had awesome survice.
Can't even begin to guess how many late-late nights I've spent here. Memories and food, the best combo.
Horrible service took well over an hour to get our food. Waitress was rude from the minute we sat down

This location was right across from the campus theater, and we were in the area for a show, so this was definitely a convenient spot.  We walked in and were seated right away and our drink orders were taken really quickly too.

It was a little rough in the middle of after drink orders, since it took about 15 minutes after that to have our orders taken and to get our drinks. The hostess ended up stopping by our table to take the order - which we guess was due to the fact that our waitress probably was a little overwhelmed. 

The food came out about 15 minutes after ordering and we had to eat quickly to ensure we didn't miss our show time. I had the Turkey Dinner and he had one of the pancake combos (the white chocolate raspberry I believe was the name). My turkey dinner was just okay.  The turkey was cut into small pieces, and definitely wasn't the long cut strips like it was in the picture on the menu (but it never is right?).  His pancakes were a good pick - the Egg Nog pancakes looked like they would have been a good pick, too!

I paid our ticket as soon as I was done eating so that we could take off as soon as my fiancee was done.  

Overall: B-
Service was good.  Food was okay - definitely an "A-OK" visit.

The cool thing about this restaurant is that it's right next to ASU campus. Whether it's after class, after you wake up with a hangover or after a late night party, you can always go get some food.

I guess the more convenient, the worst everything else gets. Not that I will stop coming here but the service, attitude and general environment is pretty lousy. Usually short staff and food takes forever to cook.

There are much better IHOP restaurants but they are not as busy as this one. Go here for convenience. Go elsewhere for better service.

I've been to this IHOP location twice and have had pleasant experiences both times.

Most recently, I visited here on a random Wednesday morning and found service was a little slow because of a large group that had arrived unexpectedly.  I was initially displeased by the temperature of the food and how long it took to arrive because of this large group, so I talked to the manager to express my concern.  The manager was very apologetic and agreed to pay for the meal because of it!

I'm very pleased to have received great service on my first trip and have the manager take care of me on my second trip.

I definitely will be returning soon!

I came here yesterday with some friends and it was just alright. It was your typical IHOP food. It is convenient because it is right next to ASU, but the parking lot looks kind of sketchy as does the inside of the building. It just looks a little run down. The food is al right. Nothing spectacular. The servers were very friendly and kept refilling our glasses, even when we were finished eating which is nice. It just wasn't anything I was super amazed about. I might come back if I want some quick, cheap pancakes, but there are just so many other good restaurants in Tempe I would probably pass.

The food takes SUPER long to be served. Kinda disappointing and makes me wonder if they do it on purpose to fulfill the waitress's $3/hour.

On the other hand, their service is pretty good.

I'm pretty hungry, still waiting for my food.

This place is closed...
Not sure why yelp hasn't updated the information yet...

name: Oasis Cleaners
full_address:
4444 W Craig Rd Ste 120
North Las Vegas, NV 89032

reviews.text: I frequent thrift stores and I'm really big on having my clothing finds dry-cleaned. I had to dry-clean 8 different blazers, all of which I bought for only $1.00 each. I didn't want to spend too much more on cleaning the items I bought, especially when I bought them so cheap! I called around to a lot of places before finding this one. They offered the cheapest dry-cleaning services out of all the places I called. A few places wanted $6.00 and up per blazer, but not Oasis. At only $2.50 per blazer, with amazing quality service, they definitely get 5 stars from me! And I will be returning.

UNBELIEVABLE!  I'm not talking about the prices!  Forget the fact that a suit is $5 and they do it onsite!  I am a magician and have some tough suits to clean with special pockets and all sorts of stuff.  The real problem is that my suits are made of shiny material with a really tight special weave.  Stains are hard to get off.  The first time I went in they didn't notice there were a few stains that stayed on (you have to look at them in the light at an angle anyway to see through the shine of the suit sometimes.)  They happily and gladly redid it twice, until the spots were all off!  When it came time to pay (The stains and suit are my fault not theirs) they asked for $5.  I thought they were joking!  All I can say is GO HERE.  I've paid $25 to $45 at expensive places and the service was not this good!  These people are amazing!
Had some shirts embroidered & silkscreened, took them less than 2 days for 8 shirts... not too bad! They came out really nice. I posted a pic under Tips & I'd recommend checking it out.

So aggravated!! 

Went to pick up our order today ( 1 dress, 1 men's 2pc suit and 1 men's dress shirt) and when the items were hung for us to pick up, the suit jacket was missing. When we pointed out the missing jacket the older male behind the counter asked me if I in fact turned the jacket in to be cleaned. Of course i did. First of all, I know what I brought. Secondly, the drop-off receipt clearly read 4 items to include a TWO PIECE SUIT. There were only 3 items in front of me. 

The female behind the counter stared at me for a minute as if she were trying to see if I was lying. Finally, the male and female began to look for it and what do u know... They found it. On the floor. Under the racks. It was kind of funny watching them climb through the rack, searching. The male picked it up and showed it to us, full of dust and ridiculously wrinkled. The male stated that because the suit jacket was too long (my boyfriend is 6'9") for the rack, when the jacket came around it brushed over the top of all the boxes that are under the racks causing it to fall. The male offered to brush the dust off and iron it. I just wanted to take it and leave but my boyfriend wanted it fixed right there.

Once the jacket was finished, the male hung it so we could inspect it. He lifted the plastic and there was dog hair and lint all over it from the beating it took on the floor. My boyfriend asked them to remove the hair with a lint brush or something but the male insisted that the dog hair wasn't dog hair, that it was fibers from inside the jacket and they don't "do that". Meaning they don't remove the fibers but they weren't fibers!!! Anyone with eyes could see the difference between fabric fibers and dog hair. I was picking lint and DOG HAIR off the jacket and was showing it to the male. I was so upset!

The male did offer to re-clean the jacket but at that point even my boyfriend was DONE! 

The male did take $1.75 off of the $11.75 total. 

The main reason for choosing Oasis was because it was so close to my home. Now, I don't care if I have to drive 10 miles to the next nearest cleaner, I will never return to Oasis Cleaners.

The couple that own this business are incredible. They greet me with smiles and always make conversation. And nearly everything they dry-clean will only cost you $2.50! I've been coming here for years for dry cleaning and it wasn't until recently that I tried out their tailoring. I lost weight and was forced to buy new pants, and because I'm so short, I almost always have to hem them. I took in five pairs of pants for hemming and altering. Let me just say, the wife is an awesome seamstress! The seams on the hemming are impeccable. They had everything finished within two days and even dry cleaned my pants at no extra charge. I would definitely recommend them!
Staff is very friendly and my clothes come back looking great! My go to cleaners from now on

UNBELIEVABLE!  I'm not talking about the prices!  Forget the fact that a suit is $5 and they do it onsite!  I am a magician and have some tough suits to clean with special pockets and all sorts of stuff.  The real problem is that my suits are made of shiny material with a really tight special weave.  Stains are hard to get off.  The first time I went in they didn't notice there were a few stains that stayed on (you have to look at them in the light at an angle anyway to see through the shine of the suit sometimes.)  They happily and gladly redid it twice, until the spots were all off!  When it came time to pay (The stains and suit are my fault not theirs) they asked for $5.  I thought they were joking!  All I can say is GO HERE.  I've paid $25 to $45 at expensive places and the service was not this good!  These people are amazing!

UPDATE:  The negative review below is for another Oasis Cleaners (there are three by different owners in Vegas).  The owners here said they would love to fix any problems the person has, but that person never came there.  They can't find any record of this person, and would have fixed things very differently if they had.  I know they have redone my suit 3 times FOR FREE for me because of a tough spot I created.  They are THE VERY BEST!!  Try 'em and you'll drive across town to use them!  Thanks guys for taking care of me!!

In a world of large big box retailers and chain establishments, it is refreshing that there is still a market of business that is predominantly filled with smaller "mom & pop" type stores. Dry cleaners are certainly one of them and though there is a large chain in town that has many locations (Al Philips), there still seem to be more independently owned locations than there are corporate owned. 

Oasis Cleaners is one of them and the people that own it, a very friendly older Armenian couple, work every day and most impressively, do all of their dry cleaning and alterations in house. No sending out the clothes to a centralized corporate owned facility, they handle each garment and do the dry cleaning or laundering personally, on site, using their own equipment. This is very respectable and alone is warranting of praise. Adding on top of that their extremely friendly and personable attitudes and demeanors and you truly have a home run. 

The owner manager is a nice gentleman that remembers your name and takes care of you. Even offering to do minor fixes like button repairs and simple seam tear repairs free of charge. His wife does the alterations, and due to some personal medical issues, is no longer able to do more complicated alterations (like taking a jacket in), but is still able to do the basics like opening up or taking in pants, lengthening or shortening inseams, and basic sledge work. They also offer full service silk screening. 

When it comes to a locally owned dry cleaner, I cannot recommend Oasis Cleaners more highly. They are a wonderful family owned business that I am proud to do business with.

I moved to the Northwest side of town and it took me forever to find a good dry cleaner.  Most places either had ridiculous costs or took days to get my dry cleaning back.  Then I found Oasis!  Right from the moment I walked in I was greeted and treated like a valued customer.  They offer much better pricing than anyone I've found on the northwest side and they offer next day service.  They also did my alterations next day as well.  Everything looked amazing when I picked it up.  One of the really nice things about this place is that they don't just give you your stuff and they're done with you, they are actually very friendly and want to make sure everything is just the way you wanted it.  Just to give you an example of how quick they were...I brought 2 suits in (both needed slight alterations) and a football jersey which had a blood stain on it around 10am.  Then around 2pm I brought in another suit to have the hem done and waist let out.  EVERYTHING was done by the next afternoon!  Love this place!  Thank you for your hard work.
My new dry cleaners.  I dig them.

I come here because of the convenience; other
Than that, I would look for a new cleaner.  The price is affordable if you prepaid. 

Only thing that annoys me is that every time I being in and pick up my items VERY RIDE
STAFF.  
NEVER GREET YOU not say "Thank you ".  
The lady with tattoos and shorts with major wedgie is always on the cell phone chit chatting!  The other cashiers seem like they hate their job with their scary evil look.

Arriving to my usual dry cleaners to find out they are out of business. I was in need of service and came across Oasis Cleaners. They are amazing in customer service as well as their dry cleaning. They accept all credit cards which is a plus in my books. Definitely will be going here from now on.

Now a days it's hard to find a good dry cleaner that won't ruin a fine wool suit. This cleaner did an excellent job and the price is great for the work they do, I would definitely come back to this cleaner. The owner waited for me 10 min after they closed today and that two me is a plus in my book. I work selling Suits and I will recommend this place to all my customers!

name: Oscar Taylor's
full_address:
2375 E Camelback Road
Phoenix, AZ 85016

reviews.text:
The food was decent and the ambiance was very nice, but several things happened that made this a 2 star experience.

Preface:  I had purchased several gift certificates from restaurant.com which *in theory* is a great way to save money - spend $10 and get a $25 gift certificate.  It has a bunch of restaurants I like and ones that I wanted to try, including OT.  So I made a reservation for 7:00 on a Friday and went with my husband. 

I didn't even realize that I had made a reservation on a First Friday.  There was a loud party going on in the back and the entire staff seemed a bit flustered catering to them and the normal restaurant crowd.  You'd think they'd have their act together having to deal with First Friday on average of once per month.  Guess not. 

We arrived an hour early in hopes of sitting at the bar to get a feel for the place and take advantage of their happy hour.  This is where the bad experiences started.  I had two glasses of wine and my husband had two top shelf martinis.  When we got the bill, we noticed I had been charged $1 per glass over the price listed in the wine menu, and my husband had been charged full price for the martinis that were supposed to be on happy hour special ($9 each instead of $7).  Very disingenuous, and strike #1.  To the bartender's credit, rather than mess with the computer and get the charges correct, she simply took off one of the glasses of wine, which more than made up for the overcharge.  I wish this had been the only hiccup, but. . . 

Once we were seated at our table, I was overwhelmed by the scent of vanilla.  All of the candles they used on all of the tables were scented!  Anyone that has ever planned a reception with food knows (and every restauranteur should know) that this is a big no-no because the smell of the candles totally alters the taste of the food.  I blew out the candle on our table immediately, but this is strike #2. 

Since we had the gift certificate, we decided to go with a three course meal - soups, apps, entrees.   Amazingly, all of the food came out to the table at the same time.  We had a table full of food getting cold as we started on our soup.  Strike #3.  

As for the food, the french onion soups we had were actually quite good.  The bacon wrapped prawns appetizer was ok, the dipping sauces were nothing special.  My lemon artichoke chicken was also good but my husband's grilled meatloaf, while he enjoyed it, tasted more like Italian sausage.  

Unfortunately, when we got the bill, we again noticed that we had been overcharged on our glasses of wine (different wine than at the bar).  We didn't think much of it this time since we were using the gift certificate anyway.  But here's the icing on the cake - when you use the gift certificate, they add on gratuity based on the original amount of the bill.  Fine, no big deal.  The original bill was $61, so with the $25 certificate it *should* have come to $36 + gratuity.  When we got the revised bill the amount listed $44 and said "($8 included gratuity)".  A few days later, checking my bank statement, I saw OT was kind enough to charge us $52. . .they double charged the gratuity!  $16 tip on a $61 meal!  Effectively making the $25 certificate $17!  Strikes #4, 5, and 6.  Unacceptable. 

If you decide to frequent this establishment, I strongly urge you to double and triple check the charges on your bill and pay in cash so they don't have the opportunity to overcharge your card.

I dunno about the food here as I have not attended during normal business hours. Rather, I broke in and robbed the place as a thief in the night. You guys probably saw it on the news. Kidding...well, lying actually.

Instead last year during a business trip to the valley my cousin managed to drag me to this place (he and his boys love this place) one saturday night. I flashed my Texas dl, slipped the doorlady her $20, and was mighty surprised to walk inside and hear the DJ playing some of the hottest R&B and Hip-Hop jams known to man.

OT's on a saturday night is not swanky and posh as many of the spots in say Scottsdale are, so do not expect anything over the top. Rather expect a multicultural urban crowd of twentysomethings simply mingling and grooving to Musiq, Dwele, Kanye West, a good remix here and there, etc.

Nothing incredible on paper, but the music was pretty damn good.

I went to OT's for lunch the other day and had a good experience.  Although I've lived and/or worked near the 24th and Camelback  area for several years now, this was my first time in.  I finally went because my dining companion suggested we meet there.  

Service was attentive and it was the perfect place for a business lunch.  I had the Oriental Chicken Salad and they accommodated my request for holding the wontons and adding avocado.  I liked that it included mango and the miso dressing was delicious!  My friend had the french onion soup to start and the BBQ Pulled Pork Panino sandwich.  He seemed to enjoy it.  He picked up the bill (lucky me), but I think it was moderately priced - maybe even a bit expensive for what we received.  The portions were not huge and we were not offered a bread basket that I recall.

Regardless, this was ideal for our lunch meeting...  we didn't have to wait and we could hear each other speaking.  They validate your parking in the garage so it's pretty convenient as well.  I'd like to go back on a Friday or Saturday night to experience their live entertainment and perhaps another selection from their dinner menu... but until then, 3 stars is the rating I give to OT's.  It was good - nothing more, nothing less!

The first time I went to OT's was a Friday night with a small group that frequented this place and thought I'd like it.  Parking is always a concern and I appreciated that there was ample space in a well-lit structure nearby.  There was no cover that night and we end up posted at the bar, since there weren't any tables left, while the jazz band was still playing.  The bartenders definitely took care of us that night and we made sure to tip well.  The music was good and we were all enjoying the vibe and the opportunity to celebrate the wknd!  

After the band wrapped up, it got really crowded and a DJ started playing a lot of bangin' hip hop.  They even took it old school during last call with Blackstreet's "Before I let you go".  We had a great time dancing and met a lot of cool people.  Generally, the crowd is pretty laid back and chill.  I'd definitely make the long trek again.

I really can't comment on the "value" because my company picked up the tab, but I can say that the service they gave us was great and the food was good. I had their 16 oz steak and their cheesecake/sweet potato crust (both delicious!). Would be open to come back again.

name: Pizza Sola
full_address:
6004 Penn Cir S
Shadyside
Pittsburgh, PA 15206

reviews.text:
I've heard that Pizza Sola is a chain, but I've never been to another one. 

The stigma of chains aside, what a great neighborhood pizza shop.  The decor is very nice, with lots of stainless steel tables and a nice seating area to eat-in.  They have all the basic types of pizza, as well as some of the more unique (Hawaiin pizza is great), but overall this is just a good NY-style thinner-crust pizza shop.  

What I love is that they're helping to populate the S. Highland - Penn Circle intersection along with Red Room.

After you order a slice give it about 10 minutes to cool off.  Otherwise, you will scorch your tastebuds and the roof of your mouth.  Pretty good pizza.  Not the best I have had.  Very limited seating.

This is a local chain, slowly expanding.  Right now, I think they have two locations, of which I've only been to the one in East Liberty.  This is some of the best pizza I've had in my entire life.  The thin crust is perfect, the toppings are perfect, and the staff is friendly as well.  

The pepperoni is delicious, as is the greek pizza and the vegetarian.  This place is outstanding.  Ignore the fact that this place feels upscale by it's decor, and enjoy the pie.

I would agree that this is some of the best new york style pizza I have ever had.  Each slice is perfectly sized, not too heavy or greasy but they don't skimp on the toppings, either.  The crust is exactly what I aspire to when I do pizza at the house.  Very reasonably priced.

Pizza Sola's East End location is the new outpost of the south side pizza place of the same name.  The pies and slices are big, but you are still paying a pretty penny for them.  The toppings are sometimes light but overall it's a good pizza.

Be warned the pizza is always hot - watch out.

After a long night, we were super excited to learn that this place is open until 3 on weekends - Village Pizza in Shadyside used to be my standby for those hours, but that place gets so unbelievably hectic and cramped at night.  

There was a great selection of several pies ready to go.  I had the white with tomato and spinach and it was transcendantly garlicky.  Slices are big and "pricey" for Pittsburgh, maybe, at $3.75-$4.25, but you will probably be satisfied by one, or two if you're starving.

This is seriously some of the worst pizza I have ever had. Totally overpriced for bland tasting pizza.
